results.title: Metformin treatment reduces inflammation, dysmyelination and disease severity in a mouse model of multiple sclerosis, experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis.
results.text_hl: Our findings reveal that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ administration can improve @<m>DISEASE_Encephalomyelitis_Autoimmune_Experimental</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004681 @@@EAE@@@ outcomes when administered before symptom onset in both sexes.

citations.NLM: Gilbert EAB, Livingston J, Flores EG, Khan M, Kandavel H, Morshead CM. Metformin treatment reduces inflammation, dysmyelination and disease severity in a mouse model of multiple sclerosis, experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis. Brain Res. 2023 Oct 26;1822():148648. PMID: 37890574

results.title: AMP-activated protein kinase signaling protects oligodendrocytes that restore central nervous system functions in an experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis model.
results.text_hl: These effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ were evident in the CNS of @<m>DISEASE_Encephalomyelitis_Autoimmune_Experimental</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004681 @@@EAE@@@ animals.

citations.NLM: Paintlia AS, Paintlia MK, Mohan S, Singh AK, Singh I. AMP-activated protein kinase signaling protects oligodendrocytes that restore central nervous system functions in an experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis model. Am J Pathol. 2013 Aug;183(2):526-41. PMID: 23759513

results.title: Metformin ameliorates the development of experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis by regulating T helper 17 and regulatory T cells in mice.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ ameliorates the development of @<m>DISEASE_Encephalomyelitis_Autoimmune_Experimental</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004681 @@@experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis@@@ by regulating T helper 17 and regulatory T cells in @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@.

citations.NLM: Sun Y, Tian T, Gao J, Liu X, Hou H, Cao R, Li B, Quan M, Guo L. Metformin ameliorates the development of experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis by regulating T helper 17 and regulatory T cells in mice. J Neuroimmunol. 2016 Mar 15;292():58-67. PMID: 26943960

results.title: Combinatorial Effect of Metformin and Lovastatin Impedes T-cell Autoimmunity and Neurodegeneration in Experimental Autoimmune Encephalomyelitis.
results.text_hl: Combinatorial Effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Lovastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008148 @@@Lovastatin@@@ Impedes T-cell Autoimmunity and @DISEASE_Neurodegenerative_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D019636 @@@Neurodegeneration@@@ in @<m>DISEASE_Encephalomyelitis_Autoimmune_Experimental</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004681 @@@Experimental Autoimmune Encephalomyelitis@@@.

citations.NLM: Paintlia AS, Mohan S, Singh I. Combinatorial Effect of Metformin and Lovastatin Impedes T-cell Autoimmunity and Neurodegeneration in Experimental Autoimmune Encephalomyelitis. J Clin Cell Immunol. 2013 Jun 30;4():. PMID: 24324917

results.title: Metformin attenuated the autoimmune disease of the central nervous system in animal models of multiple sclerosis.
results.text_hl: Furthermore, the @GENE_PRKAA2 @GENE_5563 @@@AMPK@@@ activity and @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@lipids@@@ alterations (total @CHEMICAL_Phospholipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010743 @@@phospholipids@@@ and in free @CHEMICAL_Fatty_Acids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005227 @@@fatty acids@@@) were restored by @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ treatment in the CNS of treated @<m>DISEASE_Encephalomyelitis_Autoimmune_Experimental</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004681 @@@EAE@@@ animals, suggesting the possible involvement of @GENE_PRKAA2 @GENE_5563 @@@AMPK@@@.

citations.NLM: Nath N, Khan M, Paintlia MK, Singh I, Hoda MN, Giri S. Metformin attenuated the autoimmune disease of the central nervous system in animal models of multiple sclerosis. J Immunol. 2009 Jun 15;182(12):8005-14. PMID: 19494326
citations.BibTeX: @article{19494326, title={Metformin attenuated the autoimmune disease of the central nervous system in animal models of multiple sclerosis.}, author={Nath N and Khan M and Paintlia MK and Singh I and Hoda MN and Giri S}, journal={J Immunol}, volume={182}, number={12}, pages={8005-14}}
